sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react' import { Modal, ModalHeader, ModalBody, ModalFooter, Button, Input, Label } from '@windmill/react-ui' import { addDoc, collection, Timestamp } from 'firebase/firestore' import { db } from '../../utils/firebase' function ModalFormRole({ closeModal, isModalOpen }) { const initial = { roleName: '', description: '', permissions: {}, createdAt: Timestamp.now() } const [roleData, setRoleData] = useState(initial) const handleSubmit = async (e) => { e.preventDefault() var data = { roleName: roleData.roleName, description: roleData.description, permissions: {}, createdAt: Timestamp.now() } try { await addDoc(collection(db, 'roles'), data) closeModal() } catch (err) { alert(err) } } return ( <> Form Data Role {/* I don't like this approach. Consider passing a prop to ModalFooter * that if present, would duplicate the buttons in a way similar to this. * Or, maybe find some way to pass something like size="large md:regular" * to Button */}
) } export default ModalFormRole
